Text.val: Subforms work better when there is one field on the parent form

ExpSyntax.val: 'TS01: How Do I Define a Program Data View?'

Text.val: This task writes to two text BLOBS, then reads them into a memory table.
One table is the main display, the other is linked data.
This reads in the blob, using a ':' as a delimiter
This reads in the blob, using a ':' as a delimiter
Parameters. These are typically located at the top of the task, though that is not required.
In this example, the parameter is being used to force the refresh of the subtask if that was needed.
This is the main table. All the records from this table may be scrolled through.
It is opened in Write mode, and may be changed by the user.
This is the linked data. In this example, the Code is used as a "Job code" and links
to a table that translates the job code into a user-friendly description, and holds the average
salary for that job. This table is opened in Read mode, and can't be changed by the user.
Note that the columns have been renamed, to make it easier to tell the linked fields from the
This is a virtual field. Virtual fields are used to store data for any use, where it is not part of a
table or a passed as a parameter. In this instance, the virtual is being used to store the
success or failure of the link above.
Parkable Buttons. To make a push button parkable, it must be linked to data in the dataview
